Posts.Content: Krishelle wrote: I am having bilateral and expanders in 1 week. I saw the PS (with girlfriends) about a month ago. I have another appointment with him (taking DH) tomorrow after my pre-op appts.  I think I took most of it in the first time, and now I want him to explain it for DH.  And I have a number of questions for him (now that my head has stopped spinning).   Anyone have questions that they wished they had asked before hand? Or think important that I ask? I'm battling a sore throat and praying it doesn't go to my chest (history of bronchitis). I even went to Emergency on the weekend and got prophylactic antibiotics.  No way I want this delayed!!!!!  Send me good vibes please!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What questions to ask my plastic surgeon? One week to go. Krishelle SpecialK
What questions to ask my plastic surgeon? One week to go. Krishelle SpecialK

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2012 04:52PM Krishelle wrote: Will definitely be up front about the throat, etc tomorrow at pre-op and the PS appt.  I'm sure they won't want it delayed either - rescheduling nightmare.

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2012 01:12PM Krishelle wrote: Very good point about the pain meds in hospital!  My surgeons are both tops (according to friends AND other docs and nurses), but you never know about the hospital staff!
Posts.Title: What questions to ask my plastic surgeon? One week to go. Krishelle SpecialK

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2012 09:49AM Krishelle wrote: I am sitting here in my hospital bed amazed that I am finally here after a journey that started with a 6 mo mammo recall in Oct! Every test and delay (summer OR closures, vacations, ct and bone scans - 9 weeks from diagnosis to surgery BMX and expanders. The the thing is, 24 yrs ago I had lumpectomy, rads, chemo. Raised my kids and have grandchildren. I did it once. I can do it again. I KNOW that whatever happens, it won't be tomorrow. I certainly had some meltdowns. But I surrounded myself with loving friends and family. If you don't have close people who have gone through this, this group will help. And there are support groups. I was a member of a survivor dragon boat team for years. After all the hospital visits and chemo coffees I organized, never thought they would be doing it for me. If you can build loving support with at least 1 Survivor you will learn to laugh again! Sorry for the epistle - good meds!
Posts.Title: New Here, with questions !!! Melissa_P sewingnut
